channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Thailand Warns of War With Cambodia as Deadly Clashes Enter 2nd Day
item.description: More than 100,000 people have been displaced in the deadliest conflict between the two nations in 14 years.

item.title: Bitcoin slides as Fed rate cut hopes diminish
item.description: Bitcoin's drop below $115,00 is the lowest the cryptocurrency has fallen since July 11.

item.title: ‘Trump’s trade deals are illegal,’ Piper Sandler warns, predicting a Supreme Court smackdown by June 2026
item.description: The investment bank thinks a 9-0 ruling against Trump is likely. That doesn't mean the tariffs will just go away.

item.title: First Deportation Flights Depart From Florida’s ‘Alligator Alcatraz’
item.description: Gov. Ron DeSantis said “hundreds” of federal detainees had departed a state-run detention center in the Everglades on planes, but provided few details...

item.title: New Orleans ‘Trash King’ faces a fight to keep cleaning Bourbon Street
item.description: The mayor fired Sidney Torres IV, and his company, IV Waste, but locals don't want another cleaner: "It’s not even in the same solar system."

item.title: 3 cost-conscious fertility startups that are making egg-freezing more accessible
item.description: From price-comparison tools to freezing eggs for free in exchange for donating some.

item.title: Texas Democrats to Confer With California and Illinois Governors on Redistricting
item.description: Two groups of Democrats left Texas to confer with Govs. Gavin Newsom and JB Pritzker, who have suggested their Democratic-controlled states could coun...

item.title: What Did Trump’s Hard-Hat Tour of the Fed Accomplish?
item.description: The president wanted to take Jerome Powell, the Fed chair, to task over the cost of renovations to the central bank’s headquarters, but Mr. Powell was...

item.title: Are college athletes employees of their schools? Trump signs executive order asking labor authorities to figure it out
item.description: Trump directed the secretary of labor and the National Labor Relations Board to clarify the status of collegiate athletes through guidance or rules.

item.title: Trump Flies to Scotland, Leaving Chaos Swirling in Washington
item.description: The five-day visit will be a mix of personal business and golf with some diplomacy thrown in.

item.title: Russia Again Cuts Interest Rates as Its Economy Slows
item.description: Falling inflation has persuaded the central bank in Moscow to continue relaxing the country’s record borrowing costs.

item.title: Thailand Warns of War With Cambodia as Deadly Clashes Enter 2nd Day
item.description: More than 100,000 people have been displaced in the deadliest conflict between the two nations in 14 years.

item.title: Boeing Emerges as a Winner in Trump’s Trade Wars
item.description: Countries striking agreements with the United States have pledged to buy more Boeing planes, but it’s not clear whether those orders were the result o...

item.title: Roof Collapse Kills 7 Schoolchildren in Northwestern India
item.description: A school roof fell in on Friday in Jhalawar, India, after heavy rains, killing seven children and injuring several others.

item.title: 7 Children Are Killed in School Roof Collapse in India
item.description: An official in the northwestern state of Rajasthan said that heavy rain had pooled on the roof before it fell in.
